title: Hailflow expands showroom to meet Ghanaian market demand
text:
21 October 2015 23:00 CET Hailflow expands showroom to meet Ghanaian market demand By GNA 
Accra, Oct. 21, GNA - Hailflow, a subsidiary of SARA has expanded its showroom to give an exposure of the company's latest products of high international standard and environmental friendliness to bridge the Ghanaian market demand. 
The company has also disclosed its intention to approach the market with innovation, technology and good design to meet the changing demand of homes ahead this year's yuletide. 
Hailflow is a distributor of high quality sanitary ware, ceramic tiles, bathroom accessories, shower enclosures, bathroom cabinetry and Jacuzzis, operating in both the local market and across Africa with its client base consisting retailers, contractors, developers and architects as well as designers. 
The General Manager of Hailflow, Mr Karim Ghazele, said this in a statement in Accra and copied to the Ghana News Agency on Wednesday. 
He said as the company celebrates its fifth anniversary with four branches across the country, it has positioned itself to serve the public with good products from the Europe, US, and China among others. 
Mr Ghazele said the products are sourced from reputable manufacturers from around the world with its main product lines being Villeroy and Boch, Grohe, Pavigres, Eliane and Tredex, all of whom have established reputations as leaders in the industry. 
'Hailflow is the fashion leader when it comes to the latest innovative designs in the industry as it offers to clients a variety of products that cater not only to their individual needs, but also their budgets,' he said. 
The stress of Ghanaians having to travel to Europe and other continents to buy products, he noted is over as the company has already made available those products locally for prospective buyers. 
The company has also renovated its showroom on the Spintex road in order to serve its customers better, he added, and urged them to visit the refurbished showroom for their quality products. 
'Hailflow is dedicated to maximise the value we offer to each customer every day, the Haiflow team is constantly looking for ways to improve as we are committed to quality,' he added. 
The company looks to opening six more branches across the country in the next five years, as the officials are upbeat of offering continuous education to help the public differentiate quality products from inferior ones. 
GNA
